intro: Jatropha excisa, commonly known as the cutleaf jatropha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that are often deeply cut, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers followed by orange-red berries containing toxic seeds. Jatropha excisa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and unique floral display.
